related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Johnkennyuk reported the inability to link his personal domain and Google account.
* He preferred the Google account to be the main account.
* He was prompted to go through the account linking flow several times, but it did not work.

**Problems Identified:**

* Existing account linking flow was not straightforward and had bugs.
* Potential capital letter inconsistency in email addresses causing misalignment.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces offered to manually merge the accounts.
* Johnkennyuk preferred resolving through GitHub and provided additional information.
* Mark-at-pieces reset Johnkennyuk's GitHub account and offered to test with disabled email privacy.
* Johnkennyuk proposed waiting for the new authentication service expected at the end of February.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue with linking accounts remained unresolved.
* Johnkennyuk agreed to wait for the new authentication service rollout.

**Additional Notes:**

* The new authentication service is expected to handle account linking more efficiently and address the email inconsistency issue.
* Mark-at-pieces apologized for the inconvenience and thanked Johnkennyuk for his patience.

PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: 

**Key points raised:**

* Users are experiencing an issue where PiecesOS gets stuck on the "dependencies scenario" tab and doesn't progress.
* This issue appears to be affecting users on both Windows and macOS.
* Some users have reported that the issue persists even after reinstalling the application and restarting their computer.
* The Pieces team has identified the issue and is working on a fix.
* A new build (version 11.1.1) has been released that resolves the issue.

**Problems identified:**

* An error is occurring during the migration of data from the previous PiecesOS stack to the new stack.
* This error is causing the application to become unresponsive and stuck on the "dependencies scenario" tab.
* The issue may be related to the user's location or the age of their processor.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The Pieces team is working on a fix for the issue and has released a new build (version 11.1.1) that resolves the problem.
* Users are advised to update to the latest version of the application.
* If the issue persists, users can contact the Pieces team for further support.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved in the latest version of the application (version 11.1.1).
* The Pieces team is continuing to monitor the situation and will provide updates as necessary.

**Note:** This summary does not include all of the details from the conversation. Please refer to the full conversation for more information.

Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Ollama Installation Failure in Pieces-OS

**Key Points:**

* Ollama installation fails in Pieces-OS due to missing `curl` dependency in the snap environment.
* Initial solution involved patching the package to use ollama directly.
* Later clarification revealed the need for a sandbox-compatible solution due to snap confinement.
* The issue persisted as of January 23, 2025, despite a planned fix.
* As of February 3, 2025, the issue remained unresolved.

**Problems Identified:**

* Missing `curl` dependency in the Pieces-OS snap.
* Incompatibility of Ollama installation with snap confinement.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Patching the package to use Ollama directly.
* Working on a sandbox-compatible solution for Ollama installation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved as of February 3, 2025.
* A fix is expected to be released soon.

**Additional Notes:**

* Users are unable to download or use local LLM models due to this issue.
* The issue also impacts inference functionality.
* Users are awaiting a resolution to avoid sharing their data with cloud LLMs.

recommendations: **Prioritize Pieces OS and Desktop App Issues:** Focus on resolving the launch failures, account linking problems, and OS boot-up errors related to Pieces OS and the Desktop app. These issues are the most frequent and cause significant disruption to users.

**Improve Ollama Installation and Update Process:** Address the issues related to Ollama installation and PiecesOS updates, including installation failures, dependency errors, and application freezes. Ensure a smoother experience for users wanting to utilize Ollama.

**Enhance Communication on Update Impacts:** Clearly communicate the changes introduced in each PiecesOS update and provide guidance on potential issues users might encounter. This includes specific instructions for users upgrading from older versions.

**Investigate and Address Dependency Issues:** Conduct thorough testing to identify and resolve the root causes of dependency-related errors during PiecesOS startup and update processes. This will prevent users from getting stuck on dependency checks.

**Provide Detailed Troubleshooting Documentation:** Create comprehensive troubleshooting guides for common issues, including step-by-step instructions, screenshots, and clear explanations. This will empower users to resolve problems independently.

**Improve Account Linking Functionality:** Review and redesign the account linking process to make it more intuitive and reliable. Ensure that users can easily link multiple accounts without encountering errors or unexpected behavior.

**Monitor Platform-Specific Issues:** Pay close attention to issues reported on specific operating systems (Windows, macOS, Linux) and provide tailored solutions. This ensures compatibility and a consistent user experience across platforms.

**Gather User Feedback on New Features:** Implement mechanisms to collect user feedback on new features and updates, such as in-app surveys or dedicated feedback channels. This helps identify and address usability issues early on.

**Consider Localization for Wider Accessibility:** Explore the possibility of localizing Pieces products, starting with high-demand languages like French. This will make the products accessible to a larger user base.

**Proactively Communicate Known Issues:** Maintain a publicly accessible list of known issues and their current status. This keeps users informed and reduces support requests for already identified problems.

**Offer Multiple Support Channels:** Provide various support channels, including email, live chat, and a comprehensive knowledge base. This allows users to choose their preferred method of communication.

**Track Support Ticket Trends:** Regularly analyze support ticket data to identify trends, common issues, and areas for improvement. This data-driven approach helps optimize support operations and resource allocation.
